data.title: A Dated Hotel in a Central Location with Great Staff
data.text:
My husband and I recently had a wonderful vacation in Washinton DC, USA. We met up with friends who live in a different part of the country and we all met up in Washington DC and stayed at the Double Tree by Hilton, 1515 Rhode Island Ave NW, Washington, DC 20005, USA. The hotel s nice and central. It is situated equi-distant between Du Pont Circle and Macpherson Square metro centres.

This Double Tree by Hilton is adjacent to Scott Circle Park. My husband and I took a junior suite on the 7th floor. It was to the front of the hotel, so it was a little noisy, especially at the wekends, however, the room had pretty views over the park. This was clearly, once, an upscale hotel in downtown D.C. and is only 5 blocks from the White House. However, it would now benefit from investment.

The carpets are a bit worn, the colour schemes are dated and the furnishings have seen better days. However, our suite offered really good value for money and our friends, who took a standard room, were also satisfied. The rooms all have large, flat-screen TVs and WiFi (for which there is a small fee if you are not a Hilton Honours member) The beds are large and comfortable. All suites add separate kitchen and living areas and ours also had a granite wet bar and a large bathroom.

The bistro is disappointing. It serves breakfast, lunch and dinner, but it is dark, dull, dated and understaffed. It offers contemporary American cuisine which is tasty, but the menu never changed the whole period we were there. There is a bar which has a "Happy Hour" lasting around 4 hours! It serves signature drinks and is busy and clearly popular. Unfortunately, it too suffers from dated furnishings and understaffing.  The amenities of the hotel also include a fitness center, valet parking (for which there is a fee) and a business centre. The rooms are clean and the bathrooms spotless. I did like the big, fluffy bath towels.

Having said all that, this Double Tree by Hilton benefits from the most charming, helpful and dedicated staff. The majority of them could not do enough for us. Only one or two seemed to be going through the motions. The staff of the Double Tree by Hilton, 1515 Rhode Island Ave NW, Washington, DC is a great asset. We were all made to feel welcome and valued. At present this is a good hotel in a great situation with great staff. With some investment and modernising it would be a great hotel too. I will use it again, and recommend it.
Valerie Penny

data.title: Guest Beware
data.text: When I arrived I was given a room. It smelled of smoke; they gave me a new room. Front desk helpful but more help needed. Nice room but needs to be updated.. Plenty of outlets and USB ports for charging devices.  I went to the bar first night and was not greeted  to be seated, so I asked the bartender if I could sit anywhere...he said yes. After 15 minutes no service. I then noticed they were closing and left me sitting there. The tub was dirty. The omelet I had for breakfast was probably the worst ever. Restaurant staff acted like they were put out if you asked for anything...if you could get their attention...not friendly, poor service.

owner_response.author: Calvin P, On behalf of the hotel staff at DoubleTree Hotel Washington DC, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review of your experience with your guest room. At our property, we often utilize guest reviews to help us improve our hotel operations. We’ve reviewed your feedback with our hotel team and are now actively taking steps to freshen our guestrooms. We appreciate your time in reviewing our hotel and look forward to seeing you during your next visit to the area.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Clean But A Tiny Bathroom
data.text:
We stayed two nights at the start of a bus tour of mid Atlantic states.  The room was clean and our room happened to look out over their parking lot.  While not much of a view, it was quiet.  There is a small dining room/bar area.  Unfortunately, on our arrival night, the place was packed with people like us who just arrived in town on a rainy night and were looking to eat.  And, the hotel had not staffed up in anticipation.  The food was fine, but the staff was overwhelmed and the service was slow.

The only issue we had with the room was the size of the bathroom.  It was relatively very small.  The shower was nice but it was hard for two people to move around in the bathroom at the same time.

data.title: Not too impressed
data.text: I stayed at the DoubleTree Hilton on October 22, 2016 for one night. I booked a double queen suite. When I arrived at the hotel I was greeted by the valet and they parked my car. When I arrived at the front desk the check-in was quick. My room was located on the 3rd level, room 313. When I got into the room it was dim, not much lighting, and the desk chair had a huge tear in it. There wasn't a mini-fridge so that was a bit disappointing. The bathroom was clean and the beds were comfortable. Overall though the room needed to be updated. The morning of check-out we went to retrieve our car from the valet, it was somewhat busy but took them 20 mins. I went to the valet assistant and asked if the car was on the way and they said that they couldn't find my keys. So they scrambled around for 10 mins and finally found it and I was able to leave shortly after. The hotel overall seemed nice, but is in need of an update and to be better organized.

data.title: Tiny Bathroom
data.text:
My wife and another couple spent a 2-day weekend at this property. The entire staff was absolutely great - from the valet, front desk, bar and restaurant. 

We chose this particular Hilton property because their rate and proximity to the DC Improve. Also a great location for anyone interested in walking/jogging, visiting museums. and taking photos of the White House and several other structures.

Overall, a wonderful experience. The only issue, which I consider key, was the extremely tiny bathroom. You literally have to close the door behind you to access the bathtub. Certainly not a good choice when traveling with a wife who requires plenty room for all their toiletries etc. 

On last and final note. One of the guest told me they plan to close the hotel after this year. Must has something to do with the tiny bathrooms :-)

data.title: Disappointment with DuPont Circle DoubleTree Hotel
data.text: I recommend staying elsewhere if possible due to the following: dirty bathroom, filthy duvet, late room cleaning (4:00PM), broken ice machines on each floor, and trash in elevators. It did not meet the standards of other hotels where I have stayed in DC.

owner_response.author: Calvin P, On behalf of the hotel staff at DoubleTree Hotel Washington DC, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback and for choosing our hotel.  We’re sorry you encountered housekeeping problems. Unclean rooms are not typical at our hotel, and we appreciate that you brought this to our attention so we could help make it right. We have discussed this with our staff, and will make every effort to be sure our rooms meet the highest housekeeping standards.  Please give us a second chance to offer a much better first impression.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Wonderful staff, great service
data.text:
My work sends me to this hotel every couple of years.  On this visit, I enjoyed the same great service that I have come to expect from past visits.  I had the opportunity to speak with several persons in management during my 5 night stay.... because the managers seem to be out and about in the public spaces of the hotel, rather than hidden away in the back office.  This is probably one of the reasons for the good service!

Part of my stay included a conference at the hotel.  The conference meals were excellent and they had plenty of variety.  The conference rooms were comfortable and well appointed.  This is a good place for a meeting.

I had a meal at the bar one night (crab cake sandwich) which I give an A+ and considered to be a very good value.  My daughter and I had room service one night, and it was a solid B for the food and an A for the service.

We stayed in a junior suite, which is a big room with separate seating and dining area.  Very comfortable and spacious.

This location is very central, a short UBER away from most anywhere you want to be downtown.  It is also about $300 per night cheaper than hotels closer to the mall area.

data.title: Double tree dc
data.text: On arrival, the valet guys were really nice & helpful, they gave us a tag and that was all we n exes to do. The front desk made us feel welcomed, breakfast was amazing and room service was very nice yet professional. Wonderful experience all together

data.title: Not what I expected for a Hilton
data.text: Stayed here for 2 nights and the best I can say is I got a upgraded  room upon checkin and the food at the restaurant on site is ok. Now for the disappointment, the hotel only does valet parking which is over $50 a night or you can do street parking and pray your vehicle don't get towed etc. The restaurant onsite does happy hour and it gets really loud with people going in and out of the lobby to the restaurant. The last night there was really disappointing as Im relaxing in my room only to here loud banging next door for about half hour before I decide to call the front desk only to find out that they were closing for renovations the following day so they wanted a head start on the construction work. So overall it was a little disappointing to say the least and I wouldn't go back here on my next trip to DC.

owner_response.author: Calvin P, On behalf of the hotel staff at DoubleTree Hotel Washington DC, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We’re sorry we didn’t provide the high quality of services you deserve. This is not typical of our hotel and staff, and we have addressed the issues you mentioned.  We try to make each guest experience a great one at our hotel as your satisfaction is important to us. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you’ll give us another opportunity to make it right.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Parents weekend 2016
data.text:
Bathroom was small
Last Hilton property we stayed in DC in August 2016 provided free breakfast and was close to a convenient metro stop
This property was not near a convenient metro we walked to the more convenient metro every day and night

data.title: Filthiest hotel I have stayed in
data.text:
No hot water 
No shampoo and conditioner replaced in room 
Filthy and dingy corridors 
Stained counter in bathroom 
Internet did not work in room only at door 
Front desk totally unsympathetic to request for a different room

owner_response.author: Calvin P, On behalf of the hotel staff at DoubleTree Hotel Washington DC, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback and for choosing our hotel.  We’re sorry you encountered housekeeping problems. Unclean rooms are not typical at our hotel, and we appreciate that you brought this to our attention so we could help make it right. We have discussed this with our staff, and will make every effort to be sure our rooms meet the highest housekeeping standards.  Please give us a second chance to offer a much better first impression.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Ripped off before Hilton closed date hotel
data.text: This place is very dated and worn out.  Despite this it is expensive.  Hilton tricked me out of money by portraying it as a standard place despite the fact it will soon close. I believe it is closing for remodel.  It would have been nice to have been warned.

owner_response.author: Calvin P, On behalf of the hotel staff at DoubleTree Hotel Washington DC, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review of your recent experience at our hotel. We’re very sorry that you encountered an unacceptable level of service.  We do our best to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. We’ve addressed these issues with our staff and hope that next time you’re in the area, you’ll visit us again and experience a higher level of customer service. Thank you again for your comments.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Warm Welcome
data.text: Excellent hotel, arrived early (9 am) and room was already ready for us - but cookies were still being baked. The staff was the most friendly and helpful I have every come in contact with at any hotel before.

data.title: Neighborhood Hotel
data.text:
This hotel is nested in what seems to be a residential neighborhood, which is nice,  but it's not - it's in walking distance to downtown and other local areas. 

The hotel rooms were nice and spacious and clean. I loved that the windows opened - so nice because hotel windows rarely open. 

I enjoyed the friendliness of the staff. 

The price was great for the area. 

The only drawbacks are parking - only valet which was quite expensive & the restaurant/bar closed way too early so I couldn't get room service or dinner when I arrived late. 

I'd definitely go back.

data.title: Friendly Staff
data.text: We stayed for a weekend to attend an event at the Smithsonian NMAAHC. We were pleased that the room was clean and stocked with necessities. Service was prompt and courteous. My only complaint was the size of the bathroom.The lighting was too low to see well in the small mirror and it was just too small for two people to get ready for an evening out. Would we stay at this hotel again? It would be on our short list but not our first consideration.

data.title: Bed Bugs
data.text: Bitten by bed bugs several times during just one night...although the food and general service is OK. I think the Staff shall at least remind guests of the bed bugs, otherwise it would be absolutely a disaster for guests like me who are sensitive to bed bugs.

owner_response.author: Calvin P, On behalf of the hotel staff at DoubleTree Hotel Washington DC, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We apologize for the very unfortunate experience that you had at our hotel. Our guests’ health and safety is very important to us and is always a focal point of our property operations. We appreciate that you brought this to our attention, and are working to make sure the problem is addressed. Please feel free to contact us directly so we may have the opportunity to help make it right.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Needs renovations
data.text: Exterior and lobby were fine, and staff were adequately friendly and efficient. However, the condition of the room was lacking. The desk chair was beyond peeling; the bathtub was peeling and missing a stopper; and I had to wipe the remote control before using (as it was pretty filthy). AC/Heat unit was loud also.

data.title: No Room cleaning service
data.text: When I came in no one was in the front desk. Waited 5 min before someone showed up. Cleaning service was poor or non existence.  Did not expect this from the Hilton property and I'm a diamond member. Will not stay in this hotel ever.

owner_response.author: Calvin P, On behalf of the hotel staff at DoubleTree Hotel Washington DC, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We’re sorry we didn’t provide the high quality of services you deserve. This is not typical of our hotel and staff, and we have addressed the issues you mentioned.  We try to make each guest experience a great one at our hotel as your satisfaction is important to us. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you’ll give us another opportunity to make it right.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great staff and clean hotel
data.text: Friendly and helpful staff. Rooms were clean. Location was approximately 6 blocks away. Parking was a little steep $49 overnight.  The staff was always willing to help and gave us a lot of info about getting around the city

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: The initial appearance of the lobby and staff were what one would initially expect of a higher level Hilton brand. However, I was disappointed the entire 4.5 day stay with the lack of hospitable service from the dining staff, eagerness to get paid/tipped but not provide friendly service, and the lack of actual cleaning in the guest room. Cracker crumbs and a plastic shard of something unidentifiable were found in the bed, and after being placed on the nightstand were never taken away. The floors never appeared to be vacuumed, even after use of the bathroom. The same was true for the hallways and dining area.  I am generally a pretty easily pleased guest at hotels, and often stay at places much simpler and inexpensive than a Hilton hotel. Therefore, I expected more from this kind of establishment and did not see that. A family member staying at the hotel next door, a recognizable chain but with cheaper pricing and a generally well-liked but less "fancy" reputation, was a far better experience for family members that stayed there than our experience here.
